docs.snippet: STERN--Ralph Warner, on November 27, 2013, New York, NY. Dearest husband of the late Joan Strauss Stern; beloved companion of Arlene Stern, father to Laurie Stern-Kluger and her husband Michael Kluger, and Paul Stern and his wife Denise in Jackson...
docs.lead_paragraph: STERN--Ralph Warner, on November 27, 2013, New York, NY. Dearest husband of the late Joan Strauss Stern; beloved companion of Arlene Stern, father to Laurie Stern-Kluger and her husband Michael Kluger, and Paul Stern and his wife Denise in Jacksonville, FL; stepfather to Roberta Stern. Born December 5, 1924 in Mannheim, Germany; immigrated to the US and fought for the Allies in WWII. Pioneer in the field of Point-of Purchase advertising, he was a partner in the Merchandising Display Corporation, then joined Henschel, Steinau, and was most recently an adjunct professor at the NYU Stern School of Business, retiring in June 2013. Loved by many, he will be missed. Services will be held Monday, December 2, 10am at The Riverside Memorial Chapel, 180 West 76th St. at Amsterdam Ave.

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  STERN, RALPH WARNER

docs.snippet: STEINER--Marilyn, age 87, of Westport, CT on Friday, November 22, 2013. Beloved wife of Monroe who passed away in 2009; devoted mother of Amy and Richard Schafrann, and Cindy and Leo Asen; adored sister of Helen and Robert Fried; grandmother of Da...
docs.lead_paragraph: STEINER--Marilyn, age 87, of Westport, CT on Friday, November 22, 2013. Beloved wife of Monroe who passed away in 2009; devoted mother of Amy and Richard Schafrann, and Cindy and Leo Asen; adored sister of Helen and Robert Fried; grandmother of Dan (Rachel), Allie, Pam and Sara, and aunt of Patti Seymour and Pam Fox Joravsky. A devoted, gracious and stylish Nana who loved her "mountain," her family, Westport and Compo Beach. Donations may be made in her name to Norwalk Hospital Foundation Circle of Caring, www.norwalkhealth.org.

docs.lead_paragraph: SILVERMAN--Gloria Tobias, 76. Died peacefully at home on November 26th. Devoted mother of Jeffrey (Susan). Beloved grandmother of Samuel, Adam and Jeremy. Loving daughter of the late Samuel and Florence Tobias. Cherished friend and colleague of all who knew her. Services held by Plaza Jewish Community Chapel, (212) 769-4400.

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  SILVERMAN, GLORIA TOBIAS

docs.snippet: SHULTZ--Cecile, passed away peacefully at home in New York, November 23, 2013. Born January 20, 1922, during a long full and happy life she bore witness to the Great Depression, World War II (which claimed her beloved brother Martin Unger), the ch...
docs.lead_paragraph: SHULTZ--Cecile, passed away peacefully at home in New York, November 23, 2013. Born January 20, 1922, during a long full and happy life she bore witness to the Great Depression, World War II (which claimed her beloved brother Martin Unger), the changing role of women in the home and workplace, and advances in technology, which she embraced. A graduate of the Julia Richman Country School and Hunter College, class of 1942, Cecile was married for over 56 years to the late Abraham, and was the mother of Ellen and Stuart (Cherida) and grandmother of Oliver and Simon, whom she treasured. A person of considerable significance and talents, she was always available to others whether in her supervisory position at the New York State Employment Service or as a source of love, guidance and support to her family and many friends, all of whom will miss her terribly.

docs.snippet: SEIXAS--Donald H.,91, of New York passed away peacefully at Mt. Sinai Hospice Center on November 29th. He served in the U.S. Army, received a law degree from New York University and was in the printing ink business. After retiring he received a Ma...
docs.lead_paragraph: SEIXAS--Donald H.,91, of New York passed away peacefully at Mt. Sinai Hospice Center on November 29th. He served in the U.S. Army, received a law degree from New York University and was in the printing ink business. After retiring he received a Masters in Art History from NYU Institute of Fine Arts and had a gallery on Madison Avenue for several years. He will be greatly missed by his wife Lilyan, his children Vicky and David, his stepchildren Ken, Lisa and Mark, and seven grandchildren. Services at Riverside Chapel Sunday 11am.

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  SEIXAS, DONALD H.

docs.snippet: SALVATORELLI--Louis, died November 7, 2013. Dad lived 65 years in his honeymoon apartment on Briggs Avenue in the Bronx. After he was widowed in 1980, he was seldom seen without a pretty lady on his arm. Born in an Italian tenement in Harlem, he c...
docs.lead_paragraph: SALVATORELLI--Louis, died November 7, 2013. Dad lived 65 years in his honeymoon apartment on Briggs Avenue in the Bronx. After he was widowed in 1980, he was seldom seen without a pretty lady on his arm. Born in an Italian tenement in Harlem, he carried coal up three flights and could have been a contender. See Dad in his muscle t-shirt at www.Dadadad.com/ He was a welder in the Brooklyn Navy Yard during WWII, later a bookbinder, a union man at Blumberg, where Dad produced faster, and with higher quality than the machines. On vacation through the South he ignored warnings not to buy gas from black station owners saying, "everyone's gotta make a living." I'd play piano and he'd be up dancing around the room. Dad was always for the underdog, a good man, who scoffed at pretension. In retirement, he loved driving St. Philip Neri parishioners to the senior center, to doctors and the airport. After moving into the Amsterdam House he became addicted to reduced fat Nilla wafers consuming about a box a day. He was proud of his son Louis, a NYC cop, and his daughter Geraldine, who worked in executive offices at NBC, who is writing a book about the shock of caring for aging parents and is publishing, "A Catholic Girl Leaves Home for Sex." He is survived by his son, daughter, daughter-in-law, three grandchildren, and three great-grandchildren.

docs.snippet: SABLE--Dr. Jack. The Board of Directors, residents and staff of The Hebrew Home at Riverdale deeply mourn the loss of Rabbi Jack Sable. Jack was a great American who devoted his life to public service as well as Jewish causes. He lived each day to...
docs.lead_paragraph: SABLE--Dr. Jack. The Board of Directors, residents and staff of The Hebrew Home at Riverdale deeply mourn the loss of Rabbi Jack Sable. Jack was a great American who devoted his life to public service as well as Jewish causes. He lived each day to perform mitzvahs and was a teacher in words and deeds. Jack was a treasured friend of the Hebrew Home for decades. The world is a better place because of Rabbi Jack Sable. We extend our heartfelt condolences to the entire family. May they be comforted among the mourners of Zion. The Hebrew Home at Riverdale Daniel Reingold, President & CEO
